Package hw2

Class ThreeCushion

java.lang.Object
hw2.ThreeCushion
public class ThreeCushion extends Object
Class that models the game of three-cushion billiards.
Author:
Nicholas Alexander Wang

  • Constructor Details

    • ThreeCushion

      public ThreeCushion(api.PlayerPosition lagWinner, int pointsToWin)
      Constructs a Three cushion Billiards game. with the variables lagWinner and points to win. the lagwinner and points to win will be passed on as a variable to other methods Sets the pointsToWinGame to the input of the constructor

      Sets the PLAYER_A_BALL to an instance Variable

      Sets the PLAYER_B_BALL to an instance Variable

      Sets the currentTutn to an instance Variable

      Sets the shotTaken to an instance Variable

      Sets the inning to 1 in an instance Variable

      Sets the inningStart 1 to an instanve Variable

      Sets the redHit to 0 to an instance Variable

      Sets the number of cushion impact to an instance variable

      Sets the number of impact ball to an instance variable

      Sets the lastHitBall to an instance Variable

      Sets the lagWinnerVerification to false in an instance variable

      Sets the gameOver to false in an instance Variable

      Sets the firstHitRed to false in an instance Variable

      Parameters:
      lagWinner - The winner of the lag
      pointsToWin - The number of points required to win

  • Method Details

    • cueBallImpactCushion

      public void cueBallImpactCushion()
      Counting the number of times the ball has impacted the cushion, if the shot has been taken, and the game is not over. Checks if in the break shot the cue ball does not hit the red ball

    • cueBallStrike

      public void cueBallStrike(api.BallType ball)
      Indicates that the cueball has hit the other balls. Checks if the first shot is red ball and if the cushion was hit before. Checks if the first hit in the inning is not red, then its a foul.
      Parameters:
      ball - the ball that is hit by the cue ball

    • cueStickStrike

      public void cueStickStrike(api.BallType ball)
      Indicates that the cueStick has hit the ball

      Checks if the game is over and if the lag winner has chosen the ball and the turn

      Checks if the shot is taken, and Checks if the Stick has hit the correct ball for the player (PLAYER_A/B_BALL)
      if true then starts the inning, and take the shot

      if the stick hit the wrong ball, then its a foul.

      Parameters:
      ball - the ball that is hit by the stick

    • endShot

      public void endShot()
      indicates that the shot has ended

      Checks if the game is over and if the lag winner has chosen the ball and the turn
      Checks if the shot is taken, if so then stops the shot
      Checks the current inning's player
      if the Player scored then adds a point to their score, if the score hits the points to win, sets the gameover to true
      if the Player does not score, and foul has not been called before this inning, if not then calls a foul

    • foul

      public void foul()
      Indicates that a foul has happened

      Checks if game over is false
      If so changes the current turn and the current ball
      adds an inning, and stops the inning

    • getCueBall

      public api.BallType getCueBall()
      Returns:
      Returns the current player cueBall

      Returns:

      Returns:

    • getPlayerBScore

      public int getPlayerBScore()
      Returns:
      Score of PLAYER B

    • isBankShot

      public boolean isBankShot()
      If hits the cushion 3 times and hit both balls with a different color
      Returns:
      true if it is a bankShot

    • isBreakShot

      public boolean isBreakShot()
      If the inning count is 1
      Returns:
      true if it is a break shot

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Game is over when the point has reached the points required to win in the constructor
      Returns:
      if game is over then true

    • isInningStarted

      public boolean isInningStarted()
      The inning is started when the cue stick strikes the correct ball, and stops when it changes players
      Returns:
      true if inning started, false if stopped

    • isShotStarted

      public boolean isShotStarted()
      The shot is started when the player's stick hits the correct ball and stops when endshot is initiated
      Returns:
      true if shot started (cuestickstrike), false if shot ended (endshot)

    • lagWinnerChooses

      public void lagWinnerChooses(boolean selfBreak, api.BallType cueBall)
      The lag winner chooses wether they self break or not, and the ball they choose for themself

      If the lagWinner chooses to selfbreak, then the current Inning is given lagWinner,
      If the lagWinner chooses to not selfBreak, then the current Inning is given to the player other than the other lagWinner.

      Parameters:
      selfBreak - if true then current Inning is the lag winner
      cueBall - The cueball is given to the lag winner

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a one-line string representation of the current game state. The format is:

      Player A*: X Player B: Y, Inning: Z

      The asterisks next to the player's name indicates which player is at the table this inning. The number after the player's name is their score. Z is the inning number. Other messages will appear at the end of the string.

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      one-line string representation of the game state
